194330-d-11-28-05-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
194330-d-11-28-05-SOO.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
194330-d-11-28-05-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT G02 SHOVED 75 EMPTIES NORTHWARD, PAST THE FAYETTE STATION SIGN AT MP 170.1, TO CLEAR THESOUTH SIDING SWITCH AT FAYETTE.  AN AIR TEST WAS DONE AND INSTRUCTIONS WERE LEFT FOR RELIEF CREW G02(RELIEF G02) TO DOUBLE 34 EMPTIES FROM THE SIDING ONTO THE 75 EMPTIES ON THE MAIN, DO AN AIR TEST AND DEPART.   RELIEF G02 DOUBLED THE CARS OVER AND STARTED AHEAD AFTER WALKING THE AIR TEST ON THE PORTION OF THE TRAIN THAT HAD JUST BEEN DOUBLED TOGETHER.  THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK & FOUND THAT WHEN HE MADE THE JOINT ON THE DOUBLE, THE PIN DID NOT FALL INTO PLACE AND THE COUPLING CAME APART, WHICH CAUSED THE TRAIN TO GO INTO EMERGENCY.  THE COUPLING WAS MADE AGAIN, CHECKED AND THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK TO THE ENGINE AND TRAIN PROCEEDED TO DEPART. AFTER TRAVELINGAPPROXIMATELY .9 MILES THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY AGAIN.  WHEN THE CONDUCTOR WALKED TO THE REAROF THE TRAIN HE FOUND THE HIND CAR (IPSX 78640) DERAILED.  INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THAT EARLIER MOVEMENT INVOLVING ASSIGNMENT G02,  WHICH HAD PLACED THE 75 EMPTIES ONTO THE MAIN DERAILED THE ISPX 78640 OFF THE NORTHERN MOST END OF THE TRACK (MP 170.05) WHEN THE SLACK RAN OUT. WHEN RELIEF G02 DEPARTED, THE REAR SET OF WHEELS (THAT WERE DERAILED) WERE DRAGGED DOWN THE SIDING, WHILE THE LEAD TRUCKSREMAINED ON THE MAIN TRACK UNTIL IT REACHED THE SOUTH SIDING SWITCH AT MP 171 WHICH CAUSED TRAIN TOGO INTO EMERGENCY.  ESTIMATED TIME CAR ACTUALLY DERAILED BY ASSIGNMENT G02 AS 09:00 11/28/05, DISCOV

237-d-11-16-05-GRS.Narrative: MOPO CREW WAS IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING OUT A DANGEROUS CAR AMOX 33873 THAT WAS HEAD OUT ON THE RIVERSIDE YARD TRACK. AFTER THE MOPO CREW PLACED THE DANGEROUS CAR IN THE CLEAR ON THE CONTROL SIDINGEAST TRACK THE CREW WENT BACK TO THE RIVERSIDE YARD TRACK TO PICK UP THE REMAINING CARS. WHEN THE CREW WAS PULLING OUT OF THE RIVERSIDE YARD TRACK TO DOUBLE THE CARS TO THEIR TRAIN ON THE CONTROL SIDING EAST TRACK THE CONDUCTOR HEARD A NOISE WHILE WALKING UP TO THE HEAD END OF HIS TRAIN AND NOTICEDTHAT THE DANGEROUS CAR AMOX 33873 AND THE BOX CAR TR 110050 HAD TIPPED OVER. AFTER FURTHER INVESTAGATION THE AMOX 33873 CAR HAD ROLLED FROM THE CONTROLED SIDING EAST TRACK AND FOULED THE RIVERSIDE YARD TRACK AND IN THE PROCESS SIDE SWIPED CAR CEFX 96481 AND THEN THE DANGEROUS CAR AND THE BOX CAR ENDED UP ON THEIR SIDES.
